intro: Loncomelos sorgerae, commonly known as the Mexican firecracker plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking red, tubular flowers that resemble firecrackers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers bloom in summer and are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly hummingbirds.
